p: HIV-positive men who have sex with men (MSM) have become a main transmission group for hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection in Switzerland and other industrialized countries. Increased HCV transmission among human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)-positive MSM started to be reported in the early 2000s [ 1–4]. Molecular epidemiological analyses have demonstrated international networks of sexual transmission of HCV [ 5, 6]. The spread of HCV among HIV-positive MSM has continued ever since [ 4, 7–9].
